snippet: For decades, India has turned to international aid agencies to fill gaps in its health care system. Now Narendra Modi’s government is cracking down.
abstract: India is terminating employment of over 100 health system consultants hired by foreign organizations as part of effort to reduce foreign influence on its policies; experts warn that several health initiatives could be endangered if positions remain unfilled.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and SUHASINI RAJ

lead_paragraph: For decades, India has turned to international aid agencies to fill gaps in its health care system. Now Narendra Modi’s government is cracking down.

headline.main: Wary of Outside Influence, India Limits Foreign Involvement in Health System
headline.print_headline: Wary of Outside Influence, India Limits Foreign Involvement in Health System
